accprofile.help: Access profile for this administrator. Access profiles control administrator access to FortiGate features.
accprofile.name: accprofile

accprofile-override.help: Enable to use the name of an access profile provided by the remote authentication server to control the FortiGate features that this administrator can access.
accprofile-override.name: accprofile-override

allow-remove-admin-session.help: Enable/disable allow admin session to be removed by privileged admin users.
allow-remove-admin-session.name: allow-remove-admin-session

force-password-change.help: Enable/disable force password change on next login.
force-password-change.name: force-password-change

options.help: Enable force password change on next login.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable force password change on next login.
options.name: disable

ip6-trusthost1.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost1.name: ip6-trusthost1

ip6-trusthost10.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost10.name: ip6-trusthost10

ip6-trusthost2.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost2.name: ip6-trusthost2

ip6-trusthost3.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost3.name: ip6-trusthost3

ip6-trusthost4.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost4.name: ip6-trusthost4

ip6-trusthost5.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost5.name: ip6-trusthost5

ip6-trusthost6.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost6.name: ip6-trusthost6

ip6-trusthost7.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost7.name: ip6-trusthost7

ip6-trusthost8.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost8.name: ip6-trusthost8

ip6-trusthost9.help: Any IPv6 address from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv6 address.
ip6-trusthost9.name: ip6-trusthost9

peer-auth.help: Set to enable peer certificate authentication (for HTTPS admin access).
peer-auth.name: peer-auth

peer-group.help: Name of peer group defined under config user group which has PKI members. Used for peer certificate authentication (for HTTPS admin access).
peer-group.name: peer-group

radius-vdom-override.help: Enable to use the names of VDOMs provided by the remote authentication server to control the VDOMs that this administrator can access.
radius-vdom-override.name: radius-vdom-override

remote-auth.help: Enable/disable authentication using a remote RADIUS, LDAP, or TACACS+ server.
remote-auth.name: remote-auth

remote-group.help: User group name used for remote auth.
remote-group.name: remote-group

schedule.help: Firewall schedule used to restrict when the administrator can log in. No schedule means no restrictions.
schedule.name: schedule

sms-custom-server.help: Custom SMS server to send SMS messages to.
sms-custom-server.name: sms-custom-server

sms-phone.help: Phone number on which the administrator receives SMS messages.
sms-phone.name: sms-phone

sms-server.help: Send SMS messages using the FortiGuard SMS server or a custom server.
sms-server.name: sms-server

ssh-certificate.help: Select the certificate to be used by the FortiGate for authentication with an SSH client.
ssh-certificate.name: ssh-certificate

ssh-public-key1.help: Public key of an SSH client. The client is authenticated without being asked for credentials. Create the public-private key pair in the SSH client application.
ssh-public-key1.name: ssh-public-key1

ssh-public-key2.help: Public key of an SSH client. The client is authenticated without being asked for credentials. Create the public-private key pair in the SSH client application.
ssh-public-key2.name: ssh-public-key2

ssh-public-key3.help: Public key of an SSH client. The client is authenticated without being asked for credentials. Create the public-private key pair in the SSH client application.
ssh-public-key3.name: ssh-public-key3

trusthost1.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost1.name: trusthost1

trusthost10.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost10.name: trusthost10

trusthost2.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost2.name: trusthost2

trusthost3.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost3.name: trusthost3

trusthost4.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost4.name: trusthost4

trusthost5.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost5.name: trusthost5

trusthost6.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost6.name: trusthost6

trusthost7.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost7.name: trusthost7

trusthost8.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost8.name: trusthost8

trusthost9.help: Any IPv4 address or subnet address and netmask from which the administrator can connect to the FortiGate unit. Default allows access from any IPv4 address.
trusthost9.name: trusthost9

options.help: Use FortiToken or FortiToken mobile two-factor authentication.
options.name: fortitoken

options.help: Send a two-factor authentication code to the configured email-to email address.
options.name: email

options.help: Send a two-factor authentication code to the configured sms-server and sms-phone.
options.name: sms

two-factor-notification.help: Notification method for user activation by FortiToken Cloud.
two-factor-notification.name: two-factor-notification

vdom.help: Virtual domain(s) that the administrator can access.
vdom.name: vdom

vdom-override.help: Enable to use the names of VDOMs provided by the remote authentication server to control the VDOMs that this administrator can access.
vdom-override.name: vdom-override
